title: BBC Local Live: Devon and Cornwall on Monday 16 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: harley-davidson rider killed in a30 crash with tractor .
girl , 13 , pleads guilty to knife charges .
three rescued after being trapped in bodmin blaze .
remnants of hurricane ophelia : 'stay away from coasts ' warning .
hospital bosses talk to staff after special measures move .
teams training for ten tors banned from key routes because of erosion .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on tuesday 17 october 2017

documents.title: adams impressed with carey 's versaility
text: plymouth argyle manager derek adams has praised the versatility of irish midfielder graham carey .
the 28-year-old scored his first goal from open play in almost six months in the 1-1 draw with league one leaders shrewsbury town at home park .
carey started on the right of midfield before moving into the middle after an injury to antoni sarcevic .
`` he 's an individual that can do something out of nothing , '' adams told bbc radio devon .
`` he 's capable of playing in a variety of positions .
out wide gives him the licence to come in off the side and be free , but also he can play in a three in midfield , he can play off the front , he 's a versatile player . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: latest weather : winds easing before rain later on tuesday
text: windy this evening and tonight , especially for the north coast .
but , overnight , the wind will gradually ease .
clear spells will develop while temperatures should hold up into double digits .
minimum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
tuesday will have a dry and bright start with light winds .
cloud will increase through the day , bringing rain through the afternoon , which may become locally heavy .
feeling cooler compared to monday .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: fa cup balls - who to look out for in first round draw
text: truro city 's win at hampton and richmond borough means there are three south west sides in the draw for the first round of the fa cup for the first time in four years .
the white tigers - the first cornish club to make the first round draw since 1969 - will be number 72 .
plymouth argyle - who took premier league liverpool to a replay in the third round last season - are 35 , while exeter city are number 19 .
the draw is live on bbc two this evening from 19:00 bst .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: firefighters spend seven hours at electricity box blaze
text: fire crews from penzance , st just , hayle and falmouth continue to manage a fire in an electricity substation which began seven hours ago .
crews are ready to use foam at the plant in marazion , but have to wait for western power distribution to isolate supplies .
roads in the area have been closed because of the smoke .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: stormy weather in devon and cornwall : in
text: stormy weather as a result of the remnants of hurricane ophelia have battered devon and cornwall today .
we share some of the effects here .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: moyle could make full-back switch
text: cornish pirates coach alan paver says kyle moyle could make the switch to full-back after impressing in the 34-19 british and irish cup win at hartpury .
moyle scored his fourth try in as many games , having moved from his regular wide position as the pirates won for just the second time in seven games .
`` i 've always thought he 's got the potential to make a superb full-back , '' paver told bbc radio cornwall .
`` he 's got all the skills and he reads the game well . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: high winds damages exeter bridge barriers
text: high winds from the remnants of hurricane ophelia have damaged barriers on bridge road in exeter , forcing emergency repairs on the bridge , devon county council says .
the authority said barriers were `` buckled '' and the repairs required `` staggered closure of both sides of the road '' .
engineers were working hard `` to get both sides reopened as quickly as possible '' , the council said .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: tree falls on railway line between st austell and truro
text: gwr services between st austell and truro have been halted due to a fallen tree on the line , national rail has tweeted .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: jellyfish washed up in falmouth
text: as well as the jellyfish in falmouth , jellyfish-like portuguese man-of-war have also been reported washing up along parts of south devon .
teignbridge council said about 45 man-of-war washed up in dawlish , dawlish warren and teignmouth over the weekend and today .
they have also been spotted in thurlestone , sidmouth and salcombe .
they are thought to have been brought in by the remnants of hurricane ophelia .
dog walkers and swimmers beware , the storm has brought hundreds of jellyfish up to the shore and on the beach , be careful to not get stung !

documents.title: devon travel : a38 plymouth traffic queueing after crash
text: two lanes of the exeter-bound a38 after marsh mills were closed due to a crash .
traffic is reported to be slow moving and queueing .
heavy congestion on all routes leading to marsh mills/a38/parkway outbound due to the earlier rtc .
carriageway still down to one lane .

documents.title: powerlifting saved my life
text: a mum of two is powerlifting her way to recovery after a cardiac arrest three years ago .
rosie henry , 40 , has been strength training for more than a year with fitness wild , based in falmouth , cornwall , where trainers introduced her to the sport .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: ophelia means flights out of newquay airport cancelled or delayed
text: several flights out of newquay airport have been cancelled , diverted or delayed and more could be affected as ex-hurricane ophelia prepares to make landfall .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: waves crash into harbour walls , and ferries and flights cancelled
text: in cornwall , stormy conditions have seen waves coming over harbour walls and spaying some coastal roads .
radio cornwall 's david george , who is in penzance , where high tide will reach in less than an hour , said : `` they 're talking about a 10m swell - that 's 33ft .
there 's not been anything like that so far , but there has been enough to come splashing into the car . ''
elsewhere in the town , causeway head has been reported to have been closed after roof tiles came off buildings .
mullion is among other areas that has seen large waves splashing harbours .
both trelissick gardens and the lost gardens of heligan have closed because of the storm .
winds of 67mph have been battering the isles of scilly , leaving all flights and ferries cancelled .
chris pearson , manager at land 's end airport , said staff were working hard to keep passengers informed .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: cornwall travel : accidents in truro and tregony
text: cornwall travel : accidents in truro and tregony
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: devon travel : accidents on a38 plymouth , a3072 and b3220
text: devon travel : accidents on a38 plymouth , a3072 and b3220
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: fault delays gwr 's new high-speed train 's first journey
text: broken air conditioning and a 41-minute delay have overshadowed the launch of the uk 's new fleet of high-speed trains .
the hitachi 800 engine will be faster and carry more passengers and will run on gwr , including in the south west , for the next 27 years .
but passengers on the first bristol to london service arrived late and some had to dodge drips as water leaked from an air conditioning unit .
the problems prompted complaints on social media by passengers .
hitachi said the delay was due to a `` minor technical issue '' .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: remnants of hurricane ophelia batter south west
text: as remnants of hurricane ophelia batter the british isles , this is the latest situation in the south west

documents.title: man 's torso found in sea off sidmouth coast
text: the torso of a man was found in the sea off the east devon coast on sunday .
police say the deceased man had been in the water for a considerable amount of time .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: several flood alerts on north coast
text: several flood alerts have been issued by the environment agency .
they include
the agency said flooding was possible for coastal and tidal areas .
the alert , which means people should be prepared , will be in place for two hours from high tide .

documents.title: stormy weather : waves in penzance harbour
text: if you want to share your or video , please email us .
but please do n't take any risks .
coastguards have already urged people to stay away from the coast in devon and cornwall unless necessary as the remnants of hurricane ophelia arrive from the atlantic .
waves of up to 20ft ( 6.1m ) are predicted in some areas , along with winds of up to 55mph .
rough seas in # penzance as # ophelia blows by - we 'd love to see + share your photos but do n't take risks please !
@ twitterid
are the harbour gates shut ?
just wondered .
hope everyone is keeping safe at the coast .
not yet .
the baulks go down at the end of the month .
getting blustery in looe , the surfers are out
must be coming over the railway line there too .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: breakinggirl , 13 , pleads guilty to knife charges
text: a 13-year-old girl has pleaded guilty to charges relating to a knife attack at a school in cornwall .
the girl , who can not be named , pleaded guilty to threatening a person with a bladed article , causing criminal damage , assault by beating and making threats to kill .
the girl appeared before truro magistrates court today and will be sentenced at a later date .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: power cables and trees down warning in stormy conditions
text: quite a few power cables and trees down across the county currently take care on the raods today everyone !
# cornwall # police
author: Twitter

documents.title: sand dune erosion reveals rusting ww2 barbed wire
text: people are being warned to stay clear of dangerous , unstable sand dunes where erosion has revealed rusting second world war barbed wire .
many of the dunes at crantock beach near newquay are in danger of collapsing , coastguards have warned .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: mexico and redruth share 12ft-long pasty to mark twin link
text: a group of cornish people seeking out family ties in mexico have been treated to a 12ft-long pasty at a special event .
people from redruth joined the celebrations of the international pasty festival in their twin town of real de monte .
many cornish miners went to the region in the early 19th century after cornwall 's tin mining industry fell into decline , forcing thousands of miners abroad to search for work .
they often worked in silver mines .
the links between cornwall and real del monte date back to 1824 .
the mexican version of the pasty is called the `` paste '' and is made to a slightly modified recipe .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: portuguese man-of-war wash up across teignbridge
text: about 45 portuguese man-of-war have washed up on beaches in parts of south devon over the weekend and on monday morning , a council says .
teignbridge council said about 35 washed up on dawlish 's , dawlish warren 's teignmouth 's beaches over the weekend , with another 10 washing up on teignmouth today .
the district council said warning signs were in place on all beaches in the area , and it was to clear them later today .

the jellyfish-like creatures , which can cause a severe reaction and , in extreme cases , death , have been reported washing up around the coast over the weekend , possibly due to the remnants of hurricane ophelia .
they have also been spotted in places including thurlestone , sidmouth and salcombe .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: football : plymouth argyle 1-1 shrewsbury town
text: shrewsbury maintained the only unbeaten record in the football league thanks to shaun whalley 's 78th-minute leveller as they drew at struggling plymouth over the weekend .
plymouth playmaker graham carey had scored a brilliant 58th-minute solo goal to put the basement side 1-0 up against the pacesetters .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: high tide times for the region
text: if you 're planning a trip to the coast or seaside on this very windy monday , here are the next high water times around devon and cornwall .
we 'll have the latest forecast on bbc spotlight at 13:30 .
author: Alex Osborne
BBC Weather

documents.title: dennis ruled out for rest of year
text: exeter forward dave dennis has been ruled out for the rest of 2017 after injuring his bicep in training .
the 31-year-old , who is in his second season with the chiefs , scored a try in the win against wasps last month .
`` he 's got a relatively serious injury , he 's had an operation .
he 's likely to be out for 10-12 weeks , '' exeter boss rob baxter told bbc radio devon .
he is the latest in a number of senior exeter players to be sidelined by injuries this season .
england and british and irish lions winger jack nowell may miss the autumn internationals after breaking his cheekbone , while fellow internationals ollie devoto and luke cowan-dickie are also out .
the chiefs are also without dave ewers , sam hill and italy 's michele campagnaro .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: hurricane ophelia : gusts hit 67mph on isles of scilly
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for wind in the south west between 12:00 and 23:55 .
gusts of 74 mph already at sherkin island , southwest ireland today .
however , southwest england & wales have seen a similarly # windy start
what 's happened to the sun ?
hi james , ex-ophelia has drawn up dust from the sahara - this scatters blue light from the sun letting more red light through .
^kat
# cornwall here # stenalees near st austall very stormy # opehlia # stormophelia

wow

documents.title: 'plan journeys ' warning as gusts reach 20mph in devon
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for wind in the south west between 12:00 and 23:55 .
road , rail , air and ferry services could be affected , with longer journeys times and cancellations possible , it said .
devon highways monitoring wind sensors around county , a3122 halwell camp recording strongest gusts 20mph .
plan your journeys for later hg

documents.title: lifeboat crew warn of fatal delays amid cuts
text: lives are being put at risk at sea because of a delay in launching lifeboats after emergency calls to the coastguard , according to senior rnli crew .

crew members from plymouth and looe lifeboats believe a shortage of experienced staff and poor operating procedures at the maritime and coastguard agency ( mca ) are leading to slow responses and potentially fatal decisions .
author: The Times

documents.title: harley-davidson rider killed in a30 crash with tractor
text: a man has died in a crash between a motorcycle and a tractor in cornwall over the weekend , police say .
officers said a 62-year-old harley-davidson rider from redruth died in the crash on the a30 westbound between scorrier and reduth at about 19:20 on saturday .
the tractor was pulling a twin-axle trailer at the time .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: hurricane ophelia : portuguese man-of-war found on beaches
text: people using devon 's beaches are being warned of an influx of portuguese man-of-war due to the remnants of hurricane ophelia .
the jellyfish-like creatures , which can cause a severe reaction and , in extreme cases , death , have been reported washing up around the coast over the weekend .
they have been spotted in places including thurlestone , sidmouth and salcombe .
spotted on beach near mothecombe , south devon .
10 x portuguese man o ' war :
also at thurlestone last week
similar found on castle beach in falmouth !
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: torquay need 'more belief ' after fa cup loss
text: torquay united manager gary owers says his players need more confidence in attack after being knocked out of the fa cup .
the gulls lost 1-0 at aldershot town in the fourth qualifying round , an eighth fa cup game without a win .
torquay have not won a cup tie since beating chesterfield in the first round in november 2011 .
`` we just need a little bit more belief in the final third , it was a case that we could n't find the last pass .
`` we win the ball in the middle third and we break on the opposition , but then we force the last pass or it goes wide and the cross ca n't beat the first man . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: latest weather : winds strengthening , bringing damaging gusts
text: apart from a few light showers at first it will be dry with some bright or sunny spells .

but winds will strengthen , particularly over higher ground and along the coast , especially along the north coast , bringing damaging gusts as the remnants of hurricane ophelia reach the british isles .
these are likely to bring travel disruption and lead to big waves .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: scilly meetings postponed because of storm forecast
text: the isles of scilly steamship group has postponed meetings with islanders over its future plans because of the stormy forecast .
the company had planned a series of meetings across the islands .

in a post on its main website , the group said it was `` reluctantly '' postponing planned listening events following a weather warning of strong winds expected to reach 70mph from ex-hurricane ophelia .
it said severe weather conditions forecast were expected to restrict inter-island boating on scilly , as well as having a potential impact on travel from the mainland to the islands .
staff said they hoped to reschedule the listening events to next month .
the company runs the scillonian ferry ( a freight vessel and the skybus flights service .
author: Hannah Stacey
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: hurricane ophelia : yellow warning of wind
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for wind in the south west between 12:00 and 23:55 .
it said a spell of very windy weather was likely on monday in association with ex-ophelia .
road , rail , air and ferry services may be affected , with longer journeys times and cancellations possible .
power cuts may occur , with the potential to affect other services , such as mobile phone coverage .
some damage to buildings , such as tiles blown from roofs could happen , perhaps leading to injuries and danger to life from flying debris .
coastal routes , sea fronts and coastal communities may be affected by spray and/or large waves .

author: Andrew Segal

documents.title: weather hits all land 's end airport flights
text: at land 's end airport , all flights have been suspended because of the weather .

documents.title: hodges hails truro city 's fa cup heroes
text: truro city manager lee hodges has hailed his players after the club reached the fa cup first round for the first time .
noah keats scored twice in the 2-0 win at hampton and richmond borough , while city 's tom mchale saved a penalty .
the club became the first side from cornwall to reach the first round since falmouth town in 1969 .
`` this is an amazing achievement for truro and for cornwall , '' hodges told bbc radio cornwall .
`` for all these players and the supporters who were here supporting us it 's a very special day for the club . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: hurricane ophelia : zoo animals 'off show '
text: morning !
it 's v windy here today thx to ex # opheliahurricane .
so our cats & bears are off show , sorry for any disappointment # dartmoorzoo
author: Twitter

documents.title: waves up to 30ft expected this afternoon
text: waves of 20-30ft ( 6-9m ) are expected to batter the north coast of cornwall this afternoon as the remnants of hurricane ophelia approach the uk .
this chart from surf forecasting website magicseaweed shows the highest levels of swell in an area between cornwall and the south coast of ireland .
the height of waves is expected to build through the afternoon with high tide between 15:00 and 16:00 .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: erosion causes changes to ten tors routes
text: teams training for ten tors are going to be banned from walking some of the key routes in the run-up to the event because of erosion .
competitors aged 14 to 19 hike distances of up to 55 miles ( 89 km ) , visiting 10 nominated tors during the two-day event usually held in may .
dartmoor national park and the army , who organise the challenge , have decided to create new paths to divert all walkers , mountain bikers and horse riders away from over-trodden areas .
teams which failed to stick to the alternative routes risked being disqualified from the event , organisers said .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: hurricane ophelia : met office issues amber wind warning
text: the met office has warned of `` potential danger to life '' as the remnants of hurricane ophelia head for the british isles with 80mph ( 130km/h ) winds .
ophelia is on its way from the azores in the atlantic ocean .
the amber warning is for northern ireland , but a yellow warning has been issued for western england - including cornwall and parts of devon , wales and south-west scotland .
weather presenter carol kirkwood tweeted earlier that winds were up across cornwall and the isles of scilly , gusting at just over 55mph .
winds up across the isles of scilly and cornwall - gusting 56mph .

documents.title: devon travel : problems in fairmile and plymouth
text: devon travel : problems in fairmile and plymouth
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: hurricane ophelia : 'stay away from coasts ' warning
text: coastguards are urging people to stay away from the coast in devon and cornwall as the remnants of hurricane ophelia arrive from the atlantic .
waves of up to 20ft ( 6.1m ) are predicted in some areas , along with winds of up to 55mph .
coastguards said that `` playing chicken and wave dodging '' in such conditions were `` just not worth risking your life for - sometimes the waves will win '' .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: mullion school closed because of temporary roof worries
text: mullion school is closed today because of worries over safety as the remnants of hurricane ophelia arrive from the atlantic .
staff said the school had a temporary roofing structure and there were concerns it could become unstable in stormy conditions .
the school was expected to be open tomorrow , they added .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: hospital bosses talk to staff after special measures move
text: the royal cornwall hospitals trust says it 's talking to staff about how it can improve safety and cut waiting times after it was rated inadequate by inspectors and put into special measures .
an improvement director has been brought in to work with the board and make changes .
however , in the meantime , more patients have come forward to describe their experiences of care .
sarah parnell , from truro , went to the emergency department in truro three times with a swollen eye .
three months later , she said she had suffered some sight loss and may need a cornea transplant .
the trust said it was `` prioritising the patients most at need '' in eye cases .
it must make some improvements by 30 november .
after that , inspectors from the care quality commission can come back at any time unannounced to check on progress .
author: Jenny Walrond
Health Correspondent, BBC Spotlight

winds up across the isles of scilly and cornwall - gusting 56mph .

documents.title: three rescued after being trapped in bodmin blaze
text: three people have been rescued after being trapped in a fire in a property in bodmin .
firefighters were called to the building at about 23:45 on sunday .
there were no reports of any injuries .
cornwall fire and rescue service said a `` full investigation into the cause of the incident '' was to be conducted with devon and cornwall police .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for monday
text: good morning from bbc local live on this windy morning .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and , of course , weather for devon and cornwall today , particularly as the remnants of hurricane ophelia head for the british isles .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live
